availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis M. Eagle, Sr. (Clay County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary Eagle. Father of Sarah Eagle, Joseph Eagle, Benjamin Eagle, Elizabeth Eagle, and Francis M. Eagle, Jr. Farmer in Clay County in 1860. Served in the 47th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 5, 1863, to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 134.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct, p. 150B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0441.
"Francis Marion Eagle Sr. (1826-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial 23119865, accessed November 17, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23119865.
